alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central York, northern Strafford and southeastern Carroll Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Farmington, or 10 miles northwest of Rochester, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Biddeford, Alfred, Sanford, Somersworth, Kennebunk, Berwick, Farmington, Lebanon, Kennebunkport, Wells, South Berwick, York, Lyman, Arundel, Acton, Brookfield, Middleton, North Berwick and Ogunquit. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 11 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
